questions.question: What are the basic components of a triangle?
options: Two line segments and one angle
Three corner points, three line segments, and three angles
Four line segments and two angles
One line segment and two angles
No components
questions.correct: Three corner points, three line segments, and three angles
questions.learning_objective: Students will understand the basic components of a triangle.

questions.question: What are the vertices, sides, and angles of a triangle?
options: Vertices are the line segments, sides are the angles, and angles are the corner points
Vertices are the corner points, sides are the line segments, and angles are the spaces between the line segments
Vertices are the corner points, sides are the line segments, and angles are the spaces between the line segments where the line segments meet
Vertices are the line segments, sides are the angles, and angles are the corner points
Vertices are the angles, sides are the line segments, and angles are the corner points
questions.correct: Vertices are the corner points, sides are the line segments, and angles are the spaces between the line segments where the line segments meet
questions.learning_objective: Students will be able to identify and name the vertices, sides, and angles of a triangle.

questions.question: How can you construct an equilateral triangle using a marked ruler and a compass?
options: Using a compass, construct two arcs of different radii from two points, and mark the point of intersection
Using a compass, construct two arcs of the same radius from two points, and mark the point of intersection
Using a ruler, draw three line segments of equal length, and mark the points of intersection
Using a compass, construct a sufficiently long arc of radius 4 cm from one point, and mark the point of intersection with an arc of radius 6 cm from another point
Using a ruler, draw a line segment of any length, and mark the midpoint
questions.correct: Using a compass, construct a sufficiently long arc of radius 4 cm from one point, and mark the point of intersection with an arc of radius 6 cm from another point
questions.learning_objective: Students will learn to construct an equilateral triangle using a marked ruler and a compass.

questions.question: What is an equilateral triangle?
options: A triangle with two equal sides and one obtuse angle
A triangle with three equal sides and three acute angles
A triangle with three equal sides and three obtuse angles
A triangle with two equal sides and two acute angles
A triangle with three equal sides and one obtuse angle
questions.correct: A triangle with three equal sides and three acute angles
questions.learning_objective: Students will understand the definition of an equilateral triangle.

questions.question: What is the name of the point marked at the intersection of two arcs in the construction of an equilateral triangle?
options: Point A
Point B
Point C
Point of intersection
Any name
questions.learning_objective: Students will understand the terminology used in the construction of an equilateral triangle.
